private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk per move; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk; move only the top disk of any peg
agent_1.goal: Contribute legal primitive moves that help reach the target configuration where left peg has (top→bottom) D, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O, P, Q, R, S, T; middle peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, E; right peg is empty.

private_information: I can move disks: H, I, J, K, L, M, N
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_2.goal: Support coordination and be available to move disks H..N if needed while ensuring the plan remains legal and progresses to the stated goal.

private_information: I can move disks: O, P, Q, R, S, T
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_3.goal: Support coordination and be available to move disks O..T if needed while ensuring the plan remains legal and progresses to the stated goal.

private_information: Role: audit temporal and causal consistency of the multi-agent plan

Responsibilities: verify no rule violations, no bookkeeping shortcuts (no quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or implicit macro-moves), and that the ordered primitive moves achieve the exact target configuration
auditor.goal: Validate that the move sequence is stepwise legal, causally consistent, respects agent disk permissions, and achieves the goal state exactly.

private_information: Role: integrate agents' proposals, finalize an ordered move sequence, and produce a unified PDDL domain and problem
orchestrator.goal: Coordinate agents, finalize the legal primitive move sequence, and output a PDDL domain and problem encoding this instance for the FastDownward planner.

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 20 disks labeled A (smallest) through T (largest).
Agent permissions: agent_1 moves A..G; agent_2 moves H..N; agent_3 moves O..T.
Initial configuration: left peg has A..T (top→bottom), middle is empty, right is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) D, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O, P, Q, R, S, T; middle peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, E; right peg is empty.
All moves must respect Tower of Hanoi rules; only primitive moves are allowed.

move_sequence: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk C from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk B from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk D from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk B from middle to left
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk C from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk E from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk B from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk C from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk D from right to left
solution.notes: This 24-move sequence first moves A,B,C,D to the right peg (15 moves), moves E to the middle (1 move), moves A,B,C onto E on the middle (7 moves), and returns D to the left (1 move). Larger disks F..T remain undisturbed except for serving as legal supports when temporarily receiving smaller disks. Final state matches the goal exactly.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and can move disks A..G. Propose only primitive, legal Tower of Hanoi moves for your disks to achieve the given goal without touching forbidden disks.
local_plan.prompt: Use the public information, your permissions, and the initial and goal states to propose a legal, fully ordered primitive move sequence for disks A..G that achieves the target configuration. Do not use shortcuts or macros; list only primitive moves.

local_notes.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and can move disks H..N. Analyze whether any moves for H..N are required and state constraints and readiness.
local_notes.prompt: Given the public information and goal, indicate if any moves of H..N are required. If none are needed, explicitly state that you will not move to avoid unnecessary actions, and note any constraints relevant to preserving legality.

local_notes.system_prompt: You are agent_3 and can move disks O..T. Analyze whether any moves for O..T are required and state constraints and readiness.
local_notes.prompt: Given the public information and goal, indicate if any moves of O..T are required. If none are needed, explicitly state that you will not move to avoid unnecessary actions, and note any constraints relevant to preserving legality.

audit_plan.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency. Verify that the ordered primitive moves obey Tower of Hanoi rules, respect agent disk permissions, avoid bookkeeping shortcuts, and reach the exact goal configuration.
audit_plan.prompt: Review the proposed moves. Reject or correct any illegal step, any move by a disallowed agent, or any shortcut. Ensure the final configuration matches the specified goal exactly. Output the vetted, ordered primitive move list.

merge_and_order.system_prompt: You coordinate agents and finalize the move sequence.
merge_and_order.prompt: Integrate the audited moves with any necessary no-op confirmations from other agents. Produce the single, final ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the goal with minimal interference.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert PDDL engineer targeting the FastDownward solver. Produce a clean PDDL domain and problem encoding this 3-peg, 20-disk Tower of Hanoi instance and the move sequence as a plan hint if needed.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Given the finalized move sequence and the instance specification, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward, using standard hanoi predicates and actions. Keep actions single-disk moves, enforce legal placements, and ensure object sets and initial/goal states reflect the instance. Include comments summarizing agent move permissions for documentation.
